body:
### Read problems statements in [Russian](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK133/russian/PAIRDIST.pdf) and [Bengali](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK133/bengali/PAIRDIST.pdf). Chef has an array $A$ with $N$ elements. He wants to find $N$ points $P_1, \dots, P_N$ with integer coordinates on the 2D coordinate plane such that, for all pairs of indices $i$ and $j$ ($1 \leq i \lt j \leq N$), the Manhattan distance from $P_i$ to $P_j$ is $A_i+A_j$. Help him find any $N$ points satisfying the condition, or state that no such points exist. As a reminder, the **Manhattan distance** between the points $(x_1, y_1)$ and $(x_2, y_2)$ is defined as $|x_1 - x_2| + |y_1 - y_2|$.
All submissions for this problem are available.

problemComponents.constraints:
- $1 \leq T \leq 10^4$
- $1 \leq N \leq 2 \cdot 10^5$
- $1 \leq A_i \leq 10^9$
- Sum of $N$ over all test cases does not exceed $2 \cdot 10^5$
problemComponents.statement:
### Read problems statements in [Russian](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK133/russian/PAIRDIST.pdf) and [Bengali](https://www.codechef.com/download/translated/COOK133/bengali/PAIRDIST.pdf).

Chef has an array $A$ with $N$ elements. He wants to find $N$ points $P_1, \dots, P_N$ with integer coordinates on the 2D coordinate plane such that, for all pairs of indices $i$ and $j$ ($1 \leq i \lt j \leq N$), the Manhattan distance from $P_i$ to $P_j$ is $A_i+A_j$. Help him find any $N$ points satisfying the condition, or state that no such points exist.

As a reminder, the **Manhattan distance** between the points $(x_1, y_1)$ and $(x_2, y_2)$ is defined as $|x_1 - x_2| + |y_1 - y_2|$.
problemComponents.inputFormat:
- The first line contains an integer $T$ denoting the number of test cases. The $T$ test cases then follow.
- The first line of each test case contains a single integer $N$.
- The second line of each test case contains $N$ space-separated integers $A_1, A_2, \ldots, A_N$.
problemComponents.outputFormat:
For each test case, if there is no set of points satisfying the stated condition, output `NO`.

Otherwise, output `YES` on one line, then output $N$ lines. Each line should contain two integers $X_i$ and $Y_i$ ($-10^{18} \leq X_i, Y_i \leq 10^{18}$) denoting the $x$ and $y$ coordinates of the point $P_i$ respectively.

It can be proven that if a solution exists, then a solution exists under the constraints above.

Output is case insensitive.

sampleTestCases.explanation:
- For the first test case, we can choose $P_1 = (3,9)$ and $P_2 = (13,17)$. The Manhattan distance between $P_1$ and $P_2$ is $|3-13|+|9-17|=18$, and $A_1 + A_2 = 5 + 13 = 18$.

- For the second test case, we can choose $P_1 = (18,5)$, $P_2 = (10,1)$, and $P_3 = (1,16)$.

    - The Manhattan distance between $P_1$ and $P_2$ is $|18-10|+|5-1|=12$, and $A_1 + A_2 = 8 + 4 = 12$.
    - The Manhattan distance between $P_1$ and $P_3$ is $|18-1|+|5-16|=28$, and $A_1 + A_3 = 8 + 20 = 28$.
    - The Manhattan distance between $P_2$ and $P_3$ is $|10-1|+|1-16|=24$, and $A_2 + A_3 = 4 + 20 = 24$.

- For the third test case, it can be proven that there does not exist $5$ points satisfying these constraints.

languages_supported: CPP14, C, JAVA, PYTH 3.6, CPP17, PYTH, PYP3, CS2, ADA, PYPY, TEXT, PAS fpc, NODEJS, RUBY, PHP, GO, HASK, TCL, PERL, SCALA, LUA, kotlin, BASH, JS, LISP sbcl, rust, PAS gpc, BF, CLOJ, R, D, CAML, FORT, ASM, swift, FS, WSPC, LISP clisp, SQL, SCM guile, PERL6, ERL, CLPS, ICK, NICE, PRLG, ICON, COB, SCM chicken, PIKE, SCM qobi, ST, SQLQ, NEM
